column4: could somebody verify this for me:  when you hit alt+f2, then type in empathy, it shows empathy-accounts...if you hit enter it opens up empathy accounts
on the other hand if you type in just "empath" and hit enter, it opens up empathy
(file this in the what in the everliving fuck category)
is there anybody running ubuntu in here who could verify that?
it boggles my mind that i can type the name of a program in /usr/bin into the alt+f2 dialogue and it opens up something entirely different
you may have an identically named program earlier on our command path than /usr/bin. /usr/local/bin, for example.
no, i do not.  it is opening "empathy-accounts" when i type in "empathy".  empathy-accounts is in /usr/bin also.
it's probably grabbing the first search result when you hit enter. Try using the search button one time instead, so that it stops jumping automatically to empathy-accounts
that is, click the search button, instead of hitting "enter"
it doesn't even show empathy in the results.  it only shows empathy-accounts
where is the search button?  I don't see that when i hit alt+f2
using Gnome? Sorry, I don't know what it looks like, I prefer KDE
<shrug> I only use ubuntu on headless servers
i guess i'm more flabbergasted at such a horrible, horrible bug.  it doesn't even offer up "empathy" when I type "empathy"!
what if somebody sneaky were able to get a program called gksudo-haxxor_your_boxxer into your path
I think you're missing the point of the dropdown. It looks for items previously typed probably, and does not search your command path necessarily.
